title: Stepstowealth
author: Stepstowealth
content: I see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Bitcoin is neither a company nor a business, it has a logo but it has no motto. Bitcoin logo is enough, or it isn't? The logo that indicates bitcoin is enough.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on February 23, 2023, 07:32:36 PMI see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?Well, the full title of Bitcoin whitepaper Satoshi has written is: Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash SystemIt's not an actual motto, but it can be seen as an official phrase (or short definition for Bitcoin)

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Bitcoin does not have an official motto, but based on how it operates, there would be some unofficial options;• Decentralized, unregulated,• Not your keys; not your coins,• Do your own thing,• 2 is company, a third party is a crowd.That being said, we don't need a motto, imo. You make out what you want from Bitcoin and use it the way you want.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Don't trust, verify!No of course there is no "motto",and neither this is the official one  ... but probably this is the best motto you can adapt when thinking about bitcoin and why we have an invention like this

comments.author: lizarder
comments.body: It is clear that the logo has an important meaning for bitcoin because it is a bitcoin identity for people to recognize, but it does not mean that the bitcoin logo is the same as other product logos that highlight the meaning side more. I mean the bitcoin logo does not have a specific motto, vision and mission to translate and there is absolutely no relationship like a company.Decentralized and unmanageable is proof that there is no specific motto to the value of the logo, because bitcoin has its own uniqueness that is not owned by any company logo.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: There is no bitcoin motto. But I believe there is mission, reading the bitcoin whitepaper you will come to understand and appreciate the purpose of bitcoin which is liberate the masses from the machine they have been programmed to feed. I think Satoshi was/is a liberal, who believed decentralized cryptocurrency could give the people some control and privacy of their money and how they choose to spend it. It’s been 14 years since the bitcoin white paper was published, governments are fast making plans to revolutionize the banking sector with CBDCs and we don’t see it coming because we are distracted by “social issues”, the definition of a woman has become more difficult than a math equations.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on February 23, 2023, 07:32:36 PMI see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?Is there any official moto exist? I think no official one but rather many people create their own motto or saying about this since we have different approach towards what we think about bitcoin. Maybe Satoshi just want to have decentralize option in finance side that's why he create bitcoin and he's so successful for creating it since this is very well known until today and global adoption is nearly coming for bitcoin.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on February 23, 2023, 07:32:36 PMI see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?Bitcoin is not owned by any individual or company or organization (profitable or non-profitable) so a motto or vision isn't necessary as such. If you want to understand the purpose of Bitcoin, I suggest you take time to read the white paper. It's just 9 pages https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf

comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.body: One of the earliest mottos is "Vires in Numeris", which means "strength in numbers". I don't know the source, but it was on the Casascius physical bitcoins.Another is "Not your keys, not your coins", which was originated by Andreas M. Antonopoulos.

comments.author: Myleschetty
comments.body: Bitcoin doesn't have any official motto or phrase released by Satoshi or the development team even the orange logo used for Bitcoin was independently developed by this forum user named Bitboy years ago and the community accepts it.However, Satoshi once use the word "I've been working on a new electronic cash system that's fully peer-to-peer, with no trusted third party."Nevertheless, some people use the word "Vires in numeris" meaning strength in numbers as the motto for Bitcoin but it's not official.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: There is no official motto, because Bitcoin doesn't need one, it's not a company or a shitcoin project, so it doesn't need marketing. Bitcoin devs are simply writing code, while shitcoin devs are more focused on promoting their creation before it can even work properly. If someone tried to push for adopting official Bitcoin motto, I would be very suspicious of them, because it could mean they try to hijack Bitcoin.

comments.author: fadhilz123
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on February 23, 2023, 07:32:36 PMI see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?So far I haven't thought about the motto or phrase attached to the Bitcoin Logo because for me Bitcoin is better even without the Motto. But I also don't know if Satoshi ever made a Motto for Bitcoin because I also never came across this before, and I think that's a natural thing too because Bitcoin is not the same as other companies or certain businesses that require a Motto to be more easily recognized by many people.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: Amphenomenon on February 23, 2023, 09:17:48 PMThough it doesn't really have but I rather say bitcoin motto is I lead other followsIt doesn't lead to anything or what Bitcoin tried to accomplish, I still go for the most popular description of Bitcoin which  QuoteA Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System because it fully describes what Bitcoin is whenever someone asks me what Bitcoin is that is my short answer Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System, I think if Satoshi is still alive today he can confirm that its the official motto because it's on the title of the whitepaper.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on February 23, 2023, 07:36:28 PMBitcoin is neither a company nor a business, it has a logo but it has no motto. Bitcoin logo is enough, or it isn't? The logo that indicates bitcoin is enough.Heck — even the famous orange BTC logo isn't "official" and isn't even released by Satoshi Nakamoto. It was just created by a forum user called bitboy (not Bitboy Crypto, the YouTube grifter). What people think as Bitcoin's 'official' anything mostly isn't official — it's just what the community chose to use.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: It may be worth adding "HODL" as we all know that long-term holding of Bitcoin almost always leads to success. I think that most bitcoin adherents adhere to this motto, and of course, the word "freedom" in the right sense can complement the understanding of the very purpose of bitcoin.

comments.body: A Bitcoin is not suppose to have a motto business is not a company neither a tertiary institution, Bitcoin have a logo as other currencies has for identification, but motto invalid because other currencies used in different have no motto

comments.author: savetheFORUM
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on February 23, 2023, 07:32:36 PMI see many identities and logo of companies and business having a motto or phrase attached to their Logo. Does bitcoin have any official motto or phrase used or released by satoshi or the developers?While Bitcoin does not have an official motto or phrase that has been released by Satoshi or the developers, there are several phrases that are often associated with Bitcoin and its ethos.One of the most well-known phrases is "Be Your Own Bank," which highlights Bitcoin's decentralized and trustless nature, enabling individuals to control their own financial assets without the need for intermediaries such as banks.Another popular phrase is "Hodl," which originated from a typo in a forum post but has since become a rallying cry for Bitcoin holders who believe in its long-term value and are committed to holding onto it through market volatility.The phrase "Digital Gold" has been used to describe Bitcoin's scarcity and its potential to serve as a store of value similar to traditional gold.These phrases are not official mottos or slogans, but they have become part of Bitcoin's cultural identity and are often used by its community members to express their beliefs and values.

comments.author: Zilon
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 23, 2023, 07:39:02 PM Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash SystemI think it is the most stressed phrase in the Bitcoin white paper and it simply explain what Bitcoin is designed for and how it is been represented and exchanged between peers. Like you pointed out it can be a motto though not official but it is so explanatory even to someone who just sees those lines of phrase alone or hearing about Bitcoin for the first time.
